column4: guys need help moving files from ext3 to ntfs partition via live cd i keep getting access denied
anyone help please
guys need help moving files from ext3 to ntfs partition via live cd i keep getting access denied
you need to mount the NTFS partition read / write
but im in a live cd i need to move files from my unbootable ubuntu 9.04 to my bootable windows 7 ntfs partition
um, I can't remember. The live CD used to mount things read only.
basicly i need sudo access to my ext3 partition via live cd so as to move files to my ntfs partition
it should mount your ext3 partition if it is valid
if not you may have to repair it
it is valid but i dont have the access to move the files it keeps saying access denied
you want to copy instead of move, and you have to mount the NTFS partition writable to do that.
like trying to edit a file in live cd u have to open it with sudo in gedit in order to save your changes well i need such access in file explorer so as to move my files
ahh, I think you want to use gksudo and run the browser (nautilus?) manually
The folder ".ssh" cannot be handled because you do not have permissions to read it.
howd i do that
like hit alt-f2, type "gksudo nautilus" or /usr/bin/whatever, dunno where it is.
yeah, "gksudo nautilus" works on my 9.04 install
that done the trick my files are copying over now thanks for your help dude
sorry it took me a bit to figure out what you meant. :-)

lol cool man thanks i been spendin hours trying to find apps for windows that will read my ext3 partition so i could copy files over but none seemed to work in win 7 ultimate shoulda just came here first lmao cheers again man
yeah, you'd think windows would make it easier to migrate from linux. :-)
